committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, Reserved Water and Resource Conservation

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1701) to permit temporary use by Federal departments and agencies of public lands controlled by the Bureau of Land Management, Department of the Interior.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Amends the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to issue temporary use permits to Federal departments and agencies to use, occupy, and develop public lands administered by the Bureau of Land Management. Allows the issuance of such permits for a term not to exceed three years and a one time renewal for a term not to exceed three years.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1701) to permit temporary use by Federal departments and agencies of public lands controlled by the Bureau of Land Management, Department of the Interior.
